details.long_description: Address bar DOM-based XSS vulnerabilities exploit the browser's address bar to inject malicious scripts via DOM manipulation.
Angular-based XSSes exploit weaknesses in Angular's template rendering or sandbox bypasses.

title: Bad JavaScript Imports
description: Vulnerabilities from insecure or malicious JS imports.

details.long_description: Bad JavaScript imports can introduce vulnerabilities if third-party scripts are not properly validated.

Clickjacking is a malicious technique of tricking a user into clicking on something different from what the user perceives, potentially revealing confidential information or allowing others to take control of their computer while clicking on seemingly innocuous web pages.
impact: Unauthorized actions on behalf of the user

details.long_description: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) vulnerabilities occur when a web application's CORS policy is misconfigured, allowing unauthorized domains to access sensitive resources and APIs.
DOM XSS occurs when JavaScript modifies the DOM using untrusted data, leading to script execution.

title: Escaped XSS
description: XSS attempts mitigated by proper escaping.

details.long_description: Escaped XSS demonstrates how proper output encoding prevents XSS attacks.
Flash Injection exploits vulnerabilities in Flash objects to execute malicious code.
Leaked httpOnly cookies can be exploited via browser bugs or misconfigurations.

title: Mixed Content
description: HTTPS pages loading insecure HTTP resources.

details.long_description: Mixed content vulnerabilities occur when secure pages load insecure resources, weakening security.

title: Redirect XSS
description: Open redirect vulnerabilities leading to XSS.

details.long_description: Redirect XSS exploits open redirects to inject scripts or redirect users to malicious sites.
Reflected XSS occurs when user input is immediately returned by the server without proper validation.

title: Remote Inclusion XSS
description: Remote file inclusion leading to XSS.

details.long_description: Remote inclusion vulnerabilities allow attackers to include remote files, leading to XSS or code execution.

title: Reverse ClickJacking
description: Reverse clickjacking and UI deception techniques.

details.long_description: Reverse clickjacking tricks users into not clicking on something they intend to, often hiding UI elements.
HSTS vulnerabilities occur when HTTP Strict Transport Security is not properly enforced, allowing downgrade attacks.
Tag based XSS exploits HTML tag injection to execute scripts.
URL-based DOM XSS occurs when the DOM is modified based on URL parameters, leading to script execution.

title: Vulnerable Libraries
description: Vulnerabilities in outdated or insecure libraries.

details.long_description: Vulnerable libraries can introduce XSS or other security issues if not updated.

title: Insecure Third-Party Script Embedding
description: Risks of embedding insecure third-party scripts.

details.long_description: Embedding insecure third-party scripts can lead to XSS, data theft, or site defacement.

title: Address DOM XSS via URL hash
description: DOM-based XSS vulnerability where user input from the URL hash is injected into the page content without proper sanitization.

details.long_description: Address DOM XSS via URL hash vulnerabilities exploit the browser's location hash to inject malicious scripts via DOM manipulation. Users can craft payloads in the URL fragment to execute JavaScript.
